      • innerHeight

        public javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty innerHeightProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty innerWidthProperty
        Returns a property holding the width of the chartContent which is updated with each layoutChartChildren call. Represents inner values (without padding, titleLabel, etc.)

      • handleFilterChange

        private void handleFilterChange(int axisId,
                                java.lang.Number oldValue,
                                java.lang.Number newValue,
                                boolean isHighValue)
        Handle changes to filter values. All filters have to be checked again for newly added lines.
        Parameters:
        axisId - Index of the affected axis0
        oldValue - Old value of the filter (not used)
        newValue - New value of the filter
        isHighValue - Indicates whether the changed value was a high value or low value

      • filterOutLines

        private void filterOutLines(int axisId,
                            double filterValue,
                            boolean isHighValue)
        Sets records to opaque if they have to be removed according to the filter criteria. This method can only hide lines, not make them visible.
        Parameters:
        axisId - The index of the axis the filter is on
        filterValue - The updated filter value
        isHighValue - Whether the filter value is a high or low value

      • filterInLines

        private void filterInLines(int axisId,
                           double filterValue,
                           boolean isHighValue)
        Updates filter statuses and sets records visible if allowed by other criteria as well. This method can only make lines visible, not hide them.
        Parameters:
        axisId - The index of the axis the filter is on
        filterValue - The updated filter value
        isHighValue - Whether the filter value is a high or low value

      • getAxisById

        private ParallelCoordinatesAxis getAxisById(int axisId)
        Returns the axis specified by the given axis id (null if it cannot be found).
        Parameters:
        axisId - the id of the axis
        Returns:
        the axis with the given id or null if no axis found

      • getAxisByIndex

        protected ParallelCoordinatesAxis getAxisByIndex(int axisIndex)
        Returns the axis specified by the given axis id (null if it cannot be found).
        Parameters:
        axisIndex - the index of the axis which should be solved
        Returns:
        the axis with the given index or null if no axis found

      • resizeAxes

        protected void resizeAxes()
        Manually resizes axes and filters to fit current dimensions. This is necessary as height and width of axes and sliders cannot be bound.

      • innerHeightProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty innerHeightProperty()
        Returns a property holding the height of the chartContent which is updated with each layoutChartChildren call. Represents inner values (without padding, titleLabel, etc.)

      • innerWidthProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty innerWidthProperty()

        private javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding getAxisSeparationBinding()
        Returns a DoubleBinding representing the horizontal space between the axes Uses a binding on innerWidthProperty and the data length
        Returns:
        DoubleBinding which equals the horizontal space between axes

      • getButtonPaneOffset

        private double getButtonPaneOffset()
        returns the size of the button pane at the top of the chart as the offset
        Returns:
        the offset from the top of the chart to the beginning of the axis, which represent the size of the button pane

      • getValueOnAxis

        private javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding getValueOnAxis(double yStartAxes,
                                                          javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding heightAxis,
                                                          double value,
                                                          ParallelCoordinatesAxis axis)
        Converts the given data value to the correct coordinate which matches the given axis. If the axis is inverted, this method also correctly considers this
        Parameters:
        yStartAxes - the y-Coordinate where the axis begins
        heightAxis - the available space for the given axis
        value - the value of the data to be displayed
        axis - the axis to look at
        Returns:
        DoubleBinding which represents the concrete value of the axes

      • handleCurrentBrushing

        private void handleCurrentBrushing(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                                   javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle brushingRectangle,
                                   javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding axisSeparation)
        Resets the brushingCanvas and draws all currently brushed lines with full opacity
        Parameters:
        gc - the GraphicsContext of the brushingCanvas
        brushingRectangle - Rectangle which represents the current brushing selection
        axisSeparation - the axis Separation used to draw the lines
